attributes.comment:
This letter is in regards to the increase in fee for the USCIS.

We are a family currently waiting for an international adoption from China. The
wait has grown substantially since we first applied for our I600A in November of
2005.

Now, that our paperwork is about to expire, we need to reapply for the I600A, redo
our homestudy, and again pay the USCIS for these services.
None of our family information has changed. Our financial status is the same, our
home location is the same and our fingerprints are the same.

The proposed fee increase is just another strain on many families like ourselves,
who are trapped in this waiting process.

Please consider an extension to the I171H, and if not, please grant families, like
ours, a separate extension fee or reduced rate.

The money saved could be put toward our child's adoption.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Trudi and Reno Ciccotta
